oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hudon Stephens, Charles Rutherford and mail truck at C.C.C. Co. 417, Ivy, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rutherford, Charles E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hudon Stephens and Charles Rutherford stand beside a mail truck at Civilian Conservation Corps Company 417, in Ivy, Tennessee. The dates are inferred from Charles Rutherford's promotion certificates.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- People -- 1930-1940
Vehicles, Military -- United States.
Mail trucks, 1900-1940.
Tennessee Valley Authority and "grass roots democracy" .
Transportation and Internal Improvements.
Government and Politics.
Wars and Military.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices, http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001199
